Description: Lapis lazuli scarab, pierced lengthwise, with elytra marked and base decorated with an engraved representation of a seated figure on a corbel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, mentions one lapis lazuli scarab, but there are at least two in the BM (see also London, BM, EA 18529), maybe three (see also London, BM, EA 18461, of less certain provenance).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70 (?), p. 111, pl. xli, 46)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49, p.66, p.181, pl.23)
